intro: Majorana cretica var. silvestris, commonly known as wild marjoram, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. This variety is valued for its fragrant leaves, which are used in culinary and medicinal applications.
